alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 10:30PM EDT until August 19 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR BEAUFORT COUNTY... At 1027 PM EDT, Beaufort County Emergency Management reported extensive flooding across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilton Head Island, Beaufort, Port Royal, Clarendon, Ladys Island, Parris Island, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Burton, Shell Point, Fripp Island, Dale, Laurel Bay, Chesterfield, Beaufort County Airport, Frogmore, Penn Center, Dataw Island, Ashdale, Scott and Cat Island. Rainfall rates continue to diminish across the eastern half of Beaufort County. Automated rain gauges report that rainfall totals of 2 to 7 inches fell across the warned area in just 1 to 2 hours. Several sites reported hourly rainfall rates of up to 4 inches per hour. Though only light rain continues across the area, any ongoing flooding will persist into the early morning hours. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
